name: SafeKidsCPR
0:
”Alexa, open Safe Kids C. P. R.”
”rewind”
”help”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: safe kids c. p. r.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Presented by Mark Wilhelmsson, a Certified Pediatric and Adult CPR, AED and First Aid Instructor, Safe Kids CPR was created to teach parents and caregivers age-specific life-saving skills to prepare for an emergency. Most parents aren’t aware that how you save a baby under the age of 1 and how you save a child over the age of 1 are entirely different skill sets in choking and CPR emergencies. This powerful new Alexa Skill walks you through each scenario step by step with pause, rewind (10 seconds) and restart features. 

Disclaimer: By using this skill, you hereby agree to the terms of the medical disclaimer below. Nothing on this skill should be interpreted as an attempt to offer or provide a medical opinion. 

We do not provide medical opinions, advice, treatment or diagnosis. This skill was designed for informational and educational purposes only. Consult with your physician or other healthcare provider if you have any specific questions about any medical issues or concerns. If you think you may have a medical emergency, please dial 911 immediately.

To watch our Baby and Child Choking plus CPR Rescue Sequences just say “Alexa, open Safe Kids CPR.” Alexa will then ask you this question: “Is your child more than 1 year old?” Once you answer the question it will take you into that age-specific rescue sequence. 

While watching the video you can say “Alexa, pause” and it will pause for 30 seconds. To resume, just say “Alexa, resume” “Alexa, play” or “Alexa continue.” If you do not resume the video within 30 seconds, the Alexa Skill will disconnect. You can rewind the video for 10 seconds by saying “Alexa, rewind” and to restart the rescue sequence just say “Alexa, restart.” For more details, please read our full Alexa Skill description and disclaimers before use. 

*Additional Disclaimers: The Safe Kids CPR Skill is primarily intended to be used on Echo Show Devices with a smart display screen such as the Echo Show 5, 8 and 10 so you can watch the rescue sequence training videos. 

*The Safe Kids CPR Skill is not intended to be used on “headless devices” without a smart display screen, or the Alexa App as it does not allow for videos to be played within the App itself, only audio.
priv:
Developer Privacy Policy
The developer reported that this skill does not collect personal information.
